snippet: Investors’ faith in the corporate profit picture is starting to wane, and for good reason. But dividend-paying stocks could offer some hope for market bulls.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column contends investors' faith in the corporate profit outlook is starting to wane, and for good reason; notes earnings are projected to rise only around 4 percent through June, and 8 percent for the full year; holds that dividend-paying stocks in 2012 could offer some hope for market bulls.
lead_paragraph: Investors’ faith in the corporate profit picture is starting to wane, and for good reason. But dividend-paying stocks could offer some hope for market bulls.

headline.seo: Dividend-Paying Stocks May Save the Day for Investors
headline.main: How Dividends Could Save the Day
headline.print_headline: How Dividends Could Save the Day
